title: Your last web scraper: AI-powered extraction that adapts as sites change
subtitle: Tell our AI what to capture—“product name, price, image”—and get clean, structured data in minutes. No CSS selectors. No brittle scripts. Works across layouts and scales from one page to millions.

primaryCta.text: Start free trial — extract your first dataset today

features.title: Describe it, don’t code it
features.description: Skip selectors and XPaths. Type the fields you want in plain English and let the AI find, label, and structure the data for you.

features.title: Layout-proof and self-healing
features.description: Stop rewriting scrapers every time a site changes. Our LLM understands page semantics, so your pipelines keep running through redesigns.

features.title: Production-grade crawling
features.description: Browser automation handles dynamic content, pagination, and complex flows—so you reliably extract from modern, JavaScript-heavy sites.

features.title: ETL-ready outputs
features.description: Export to JSON, CSV, Excel, or stream via API/webhooks into your data warehouse, BI, or ML stack. Clean data, ready for analysis.

features.title: Managed Data-as-a-Service
features.description: Prefer white-glove? We can operate and monitor jobs, handle retries, and deliver guaranteed SLAs and QA checks—so your team focuses on insights.

features.title: Compliance-first by design
features.description: Respectful crawling with rate limiting and rules adherence, auditability, and controls to avoid sensitive data—built for responsible data collection.

faqs.question: How is this different from traditional scrapers with CSS selectors?
faqs.answer: Classic scrapers rely on brittle rules that break when layouts change. Our AI understands page content semantically, so you can request fields in plain English and get consistent, structured outputs—even as sites evolve—dramatically reducing setup and maintenance.

faqs.question: Will it work on dynamic, JavaScript-heavy sites or pages behind simple flows?
faqs.answer: Yes. We use real browser automation to render dynamic content, support pagination and common flows, and extract reliably from modern front-ends. For heavily protected or complex workflows, our managed DaaS team can configure and monitor bespoke runs.

faqs.question: Is web scraping legal and compliant?
faqs.answer: Always follow applicable laws, website terms, and ethical guidelines. We provide controls for respectful crawling (e.g., rate limits, rules adherence) and options to avoid collecting sensitive data. If in doubt, consult your legal counsel regarding your specific use case.

faqs.question: How accurate is the AI compared to rule-based scrapers?
faqs.answer: The AI uses large language models to interpret context and labels, producing stable, schema-consistent results across layout variations. You can define target fields and validation rules, and we offer monitoring and QA options to keep accuracy high over time.

faqs.question: How do I get the data into my stack?
faqs.answer: Export to JSON/CSV/Excel or stream via API and webhooks. Send data to cloud storage or databases, or plug it into your ETL/ELT and BI tools. The output schema is consistent and ready for downstream analytics and modeling.

about: We set out to make web data accessible to everyone—without brittle CSS selectors or complex scripts. Our platform combines production browser automation with Google’s Gemini LLM to understand page structure and extract exactly the fields you care about, reliably and at scale. Hosted on battle-tested infrastructure and designed with responsible data collection in mind, we help teams ship data products faster, cut maintenance, and focus on insights—not plumbing.

visual_mood.target_emotion: Confidence and control while feeling empowered to extract data safely and at scale

design.typography_style: Primary: Inter (or IBM Plex Sans) for UI and marketing copy. Code: JetBrains Mono (or Fira Code) for snippets and inline tokens. Type scale: 16–18 px body, 28–36 px H2, 44–56 px H1 (tight hero), 1.5–1.7 line-height for paragraphs. Use 500–600 weight for headings to feel solid but not shouty. Enable tabular numerals for metrics. Text color: #0B1220 on light backgrounds; secondary text #5A6372; link color uses Primary with 2 px underline offset. Maintain minimum contrast AA (normal text ≥4.5:1, large text ≥3:1).
design.layout_approach: Conversion-first, credibility-heavy SaaS layout optimized for a broad audience: 1) Hero section: Clear value prop (“AI-Powered Web Data Extraction for everyone”), short explainer, single primary CTA (“Start free”) and secondary (“See API docs”). Optional URL input demo: a simple field to paste a page URL + ‘Extract sample’ to reduce perceived complexity. 2) Trust signals above the fold: customer logos, uptime %, SOC 2/GDPR badges, ‘Respects robots.txt by default’ note to emphasize ethical compliance. 3) Feature/value grid (3–6 cards): AI-assisted selector training, anti-bot evasion & rotation, scheduling, ETL/export (CSV/JSON/Parquet/S3/BigQuery), structured schema mapping, monitoring & alerts. 4) Code-first section: Tabs for Python/Node/cURL with copy-to-clipboard, one-liner quickstart, and a live-key masked example. 5) Use cases by audience: developers (API & SDK), analysts (no-code templates), marketing (SERP/pricing), ops (monitoring), research (compliance). Include outcome metrics (time saved, accuracy). 6) Interactive proof: mini ‘template gallery’ or wizard to choose site type and output fields; show the resulting schema preview. 7) Social proof: testimonial with measurable result, star rating, link to case studies. 8) Pricing: transparent tiers with monthly/annual toggle, usage caps visualized as bars; ‘Compare plans’ drawer. Show Fair Use & compliance note. 9) Reliability & security: architecture diagram, IP rotation, encryption, data residency, audit logs, status page link, SLA. 10) Footer: docs, SDKs, status, security, legal, acceptable use, contact. Conversion principles: one dominant CTA color (Primary), accent for positive confirmations (Accent). Keep primary CTA persistent (sticky on mobile). Remove friction: email-only signup, SSO options, immediate trial with limited credits. Use progressive disclosure to avoid overwhelm. Encourage momentum: onboarding checklist with progress bar. Urgency ethically: indicate remaining free credits. Accessibility/usability baked-in: visible focus rings (3 px, high-contrast), 44×44 px touch targets, never use color alone to denote status (add icons/labels), descriptive form labels and helper text, inline validation with specific guidance, ARIA-live regions for async actions, motion reduced via prefers-reduced-motion, skeleton loaders for perceived performance, keyboard-accessible tabs/menus, charts with data tables and accessible descriptions. Information density: carded sections with 16–24 px padding, 8–12 px corner radius, soft shadows for elevation. Grid: 12-col responsive, max width ~1200 px, generous white space to balance technical depth with approachability.
design.imagery_style: Product-first visuals with light, technical polish. Lead with crisp UI screenshots and code overlays; complement with abstract ‘data flow’ gradients (Primary→Secondary), subtle dotted grids, and line-based diagrams that imply extraction→transform→load. Avoid cliché ‘hacker’ imagery; prefer clean systems/design tokens. Use animated micro-demos (reduced-motion fallback) to show selector training or scheduling. Iconography: lightweight outline icons with occasional filled accent for emphasis. Data visualizations: minimal, high-contrast, annotated with plain-language insights.
ui_elements: Primary CTA button with strong contrast and loading states
Hero URL-input demo with domain validation and sample sites
Code block with language tabs (Python/Node/cURL) and copy-to-clipboard
Template gallery with filters (e.g., e-commerce, news, jobs)
Schema/field mapper with drag-to-reorder and required-field badges
Scheduler with cron presets and timezone selector
Job run table with status pills (success/warn/fail) plus retry action
Run detail view with logs, response samples, and downloaded file links
API key management modal with scoping and one-time reveal
Onboarding checklist (connect source, run first job, set export)
Toast notifications for async events with ARIA-live
Inline validation for forms (field-level tips, error summaries)
Pricing toggle (monthly/annual) with cost estimator mini-calculator
Status indicator in header linking to /status
Command palette (Ctrl/Cmd+K) for power users
Keyboard-accessible tab and accordion components
Dark mode toggle with preserved contrast (optional)
Empty states with helpful links to docs/templates
Breadcrumbs and sticky sub-nav for long docs pages
Search-as-you-type docs search with results categorization

businessAnalysis.business_type: AI-powered web scraping/data extraction SaaS (Data-as-a-Service, Web Crawling & ETL)
businessAnalysis.target_audience: Developers, data engineers, growth/market intelligence teams, analysts, researchers, and non-technical business users (SMB to enterprise) who need structured web data.
businessAnalysis.business_model: B2B SaaS with usage-based subscriptions (API/credit-based) and freemium/no-code tier; optional managed/enterprise services.
key_value_props: AI-driven field detection and schema inference (no CSS/XPath required).
No-code/low-code point-and-click extractor for non-technical users.
Scalable cloud crawling with scheduling, concurrency, and orchestration.
Built-in proxy/IP rotation and anti-bot handling (including CAPTCHA management).
Self-healing scrapers that adapt to DOM/site changes to reduce maintenance.
High data quality via validation, normalization, and deduplication.
Flexible delivery: real-time API, webhooks, and connectors to warehouses/lakes/storage.
Prebuilt templates for common use cases (ecommerce, jobs, real estate, news, SERP).
Monitoring, logging, and alerting for reliability and SLA adherence.
Compliance tooling (robots.txt handling, rate limits, consent/audit logs) and governance.
Team collaboration features: RBAC, workspaces, versioning of extractors.
competitive_advantages: Proprietary AI models for layout understanding that reduce setup and maintenance time.
Self-healing/auto-maintaining extractors resilient to site and DOM changes.
Unified end-to-end platform (crawl, extract, transform, deliver) vs piecemeal DIY stacks.
Enterprise-grade reliability with managed proxies and dynamic browser automation.
Accessible UX “for anyone” while offering powerful APIs/SDKs for developers.
Rapid time-to-value via templates, auto-discovery, and schema inference.
Strong observability: run histories, QA metrics, anomaly detection, and alerts.
Compliance-first posture and governance suitable for regulated/enterprise buyers.
Flexible data outputs (JSON/CSV/Parquet) and integration patterns (batch/stream).
